page.title: 19BUCKS MEADOW STABLES
page.content: The stables,established for 25 years, stands in 12 acres of land,including an orchard,an indoor arena and cindering.25 horses are stabled here including liveries.Lessons are given daily but most take place at the weekend.Beginners and advanced riders are catered for and lessons cost Â£4.00 per hour.The Manager works single handed during the week,but has a team of volunteer helpers at the weekend. Girls,aged between 12 and 20, muck out the stables, groom the horses and help with the lessons by acting as a leader .In return they may be able to ride the horses that they have taken care of. The Manager's day starts at 7.30 a.m. and finishes after 5 p.m. She earns the very low wage of Â£40.00 per week,but loves the work and horses.One barn has been converted by the owner's son into a vehicle repair shop.
